reviews.review_msg: One of the most caring profs ever. really shows a love for science. Wants to see his students succeed which is honestly refreshing at this school. Quizzes are quite tough but he makes sure grading in the end is fair.

The only thing I want to complain is he does not like answer students' question. However, you could ask TA instead. His test is fair since he gives a choice among questions. You choose 9/15 to respond so that it is fine if you do not remember very tiny details(I do not recommend to skip through the materials).

Barry Honda is a nightmare. He is condescending and rude when you ask questions, gives no idea as to what to expect on exams, tests an incredibly narrow amount of the extensive material and he flat out told the class multiple times "Oh that technique isn't used anymore so you don't have to know it," and proceeded to test on it. Avoid at all costs.

He is a pretty nice guy, but clearly he is tired of teaching this class :p. The notes are incomplete so that you have to come to class, but he doesn't give enough information on each topic in class. He is organized and his midterm and final midterm are fair as he gives 5 questions for each section and has you pick 3 to answer. Picks excellent TA's.
He's terrible. The content of class is useless, but his TA is good.

I am now almost at the point of graduating, and can safely say that Dr.Honda is by far the worst SFU MBB prof that I have encountered. Lectures are so unorganized, with many unnecessary slides, and brutal exams. Way too much emphasis on unimportant and complicated theoretical material and way too little emphasis on actual lab techniques. Avoid him.

He is extremely unhelpful. If you ask him a question, he will spend more time trying to make you sound dumb rather then help. Awful teacher, his notes are terrible. Does not at all help to prepare you for his exams which are very hard. One of the worst teacher I have had. He thinks he is funny and makes dumb jokes throughout class.
Dr. Honda is the best!! I could not have asked for a more riveting professor. He is so friendly, approachable and willing to help.

To get a good mark in MB, you will need to study diligently. I studied hard and got a good mark. The rest is irrelevant. He has his off days, breezes by slides and he does harp on being a good student a lot. In the end, he showed he cared... helpful e-mails, work experience postings, dressing up for charity and scaling.

A simple truth: if you are unintelligent or irritable, just keep your distance from honda because he will eat you. If on the other hand you and intelligent and respectful, you will get along just fine and will probably find his class easy.

Do not take classes with him. His lecture notes are unclear and all over the place.  He can be funny at times, but I'd rather have a prof who can deliver the material in a concise manner.  Exams are unfair too because its marked VERY specifically.  They look for SPECIFIC words in every answer.  Dont do it, I warn you.

Not a good teacher. Hard to learn from.  Very bad notes and poor/little explanation of notes.  Need to learn a lot on your own.  Take MBB 331 co-currently if possible; some overlap.  Avoid him if possible, otherwise can get somewhat decent grade due to lab (worth 40%).

He may not be the best lecturer, but he is definitely one of the MOST intelligent profs I've ever met. You will gain a lot from his class (mostly through self-studying) and will learn not to over-rely on prof's class notes. Very tough, but interesting final exam that reflects your understanding of the course's "whole picture". Very flexible!

maybe he is one of those profs bad in lecture, but good in the labs. I didn't have a single problem with him, the final was a bit hard, but other than that, he was totally fine. Perhaps a little too much extra info covered in lectures not covered in labs, but still, I learned a lot in that class.

his lectures drag on forever and he doesn't explain the material very well.  if you ask him to explain something that you don't understand, he'll just say one or two sentences about it and tell you its mostly common sense.  he's a pretty hard marker.

Lectures contained so much material not used in lab. Went to ask him questions ONCE - waited forever while he typed his email WHILE we were asking. Lectures felt kinda scattered and notes messy to me(i.e. as opposed to northwood's notes). (Lab notebook, quizzes reports, 1 midterm & 1 final required)

The thing.... that I.... notice the most.... during his....lectures....... is that he always.... pauses between every few words....or so.  Generally unclear, and tends to be a little scattered.  Drags on lectures for longer than they need to be.
No Comments
I'm sure he's a good person.  Really, I am.

worst attitude towards students ever!! if you can't figure something out, he wants you to try and find out on your own and if you still can't and you go ask him he treats you like you're a complete idiot.

He seems like a really smart guy but doesn't like the students.  Very sarcastic.  The lecture is fair, but the lab componenet is demanding.  Make friends with the staff at the library reserves b/c you'll have to go there for Sambrook all the time!
